titleInfo.title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1947-03-15 - Part 1

mods.accessCondition: This audio file is the property of the Country Music Hall of Fame® and Museum and may be protected by U.S. and international copyright laws. To inquire about use permissions and obtain a high-quality version of this, contact audio@countrymusichalloffame.org. Please cite audio file information in email.
mods.abstract: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from March 15, 1947. Featuring Louie Buck (announcer), Red Foley (host/performer) and performers the Old Hickory Singers, the Duke Of Paducah, Grandpa Jones, Minnie Pearl, Eddie Hill, Ray ""Duck"" Atkins, Wally Fowler and his Oak Ridge Quartet, and Tommy Jackson. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN.

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum
